sentence: Sandeep Mahindroo Hello, everyone, and welcome to the earnings call to discuss Q4 FY2022 earnings release.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: I am Sandeep from the Investor Relations team in Bangalore.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Joining us today on this earnings call is CEO and MD, Mr. Salil Parekh; CFO, Mr. Nilanjan Roy; along with other members of the senior management team.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We will start the call with some remarks on the performance of the company by Salil and Nilanjan.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Subsequent to which we will open the call for questions.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Please note that anything that we say, which refers to our outlook for the future is a forward-looking statement, which must be read in conjunction with the risk that the company faces.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: A full statement and explanation of these risks is available in our filings with the SEC, which can be found on www.sec.gov.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: I would now like to turn it over to Salil.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Salil Parekh Thanks, Sandeep.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Good morning, good afternoon, and good evening to everyone joining on the call.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Thank you for taking the time to join us today.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We have had an exceptional year with an annual growth of 19.7% in constant currency terms, which is the fastest growth we have seen in 11 years.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We are gaining market share.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We are building on our leadership in cloud and digital, and we are a part of more and more programs that our clients are looking at in digital transformation.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Growth was broad-based across business segments, service lines and geographies.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Each of our business segments grew in double digits.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: The top 3 grew in high teens, U.S. and Europe grew over 20%.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: The North America region crossed $10 bn in revenue, while Financial Services crossed $5 bn revenue milestones.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our digital revenues now account for 59.2% and grew at 41.2% for the year.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our digital revenues crossed $10 bn annualized on a run-rate basis.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Within digital, our cloud work is growing faster, and our Cobalt Cloud capabilities have seen significant traction with our clients.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our growth has been accompanied by robust operating margins of 23.0%.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We delivered these margins while maintaining focus on our employees with increased compensation and benefits.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our large deal wins were at $9.5 bn for the full year and were $2.3 bn for Q4.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Our net new percentage was 40% for the year and 48% for Q4, helping us set up a strong growth foundation for financial year 2023.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our Q4 revenue growth was 20.6% YoY and 1.2% QoQ in constant currency terms.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our industry-leading performance in FY2022 would not have been possible without the relentless commitment from our employees.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: I am extremely proud as well as grateful for the extraordinary efforts in delivering success for our clients.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our last 12 months' attrition increased to 27.7%.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our quarterly annualized attrition declined by approximately 5 percentage points on a sequential basis.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: We recruited 85,000 college graduates in this financial year.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: In the fourth quarter, we had a net addition of 22,000 employees.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We have an overall strong recruitment program.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: This is a reflection of our enhanced recruitment capabilities, solid brand and deep penetration into various talent markets.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: This increases our comfort to support clients in their digital transformation agenda as we look ahead.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We have initiated our compensation review exercise for this financial year.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We have planned this exercise so that we can focus on employee segments that need greater attention while also covering a broader group with regular increases.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: As in the past, we will look at individual performance, skills and market benchmarks while determining individual compensation increases.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We will focus on accelerated career growth, targeted development and opportunity to work on cutting-edge digital innovation globally.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our strategy launched 4 years ago has served us well.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We have delivered industry- leading growth and industry-leading TSR.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Looking ahead to the next phase to further enhance our leadership on the digital innovation curve, we plan to expand our capabilities in scaling our cloud business, expanding digital capability, expanding on our automation work and increasing relevance with our large clients and tech natives and also strengthen our employee value proposition.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our focus on staying ahead in the cloud and digital ecosystem, the focus on our employees and the costs give us strong confidence for the future.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our sustained momentum in FY2022, large deal wins, robust deal pipeline and client confidence give us comfort to guide for 13% to 15% growth in FY2023 in constant currency.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: As we look ahead – as we build our new strategy, that is looking at cloud and the digital ecosystem, our focus on employees and the costs related to the post-COVID work environment, result in our operating margin guidance to be at 21% to 23% for FY2023.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: In terms of our business segment performance, let me go through the highlights by segment.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Financial Services segment grew at 14.1% in constant currency, with 8 large deal wins during the quarter and 27 large deal wins in FY2022.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our US business continues to lead the growth as we work on large transformation programs.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our overall large deal pipeline in Financial Services is healthy across the regions.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Retail segment growth was at 16.5% in constant currency.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: As clients focus on digital and cost takeout programs.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We are seeing integrated outsourcing deals and transformation programs in the areas of e-commerce, revenue growth management, supply chain, product life cycle management.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We won 16 large deals from the segment in the last year and continue to have a healthy deal pipeline.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: The Communications vertical grew strongly at 29.2% in constant currency.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We see customer experience, IT and network simplification, lean and automated zero-touch operations, time to market and integrated data for digital enterprise as the key themes for clients in this segment.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Energy, Utilities, Resources and Services segment growth increased further to 17.8% in constant currency.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We see continued and increased emphasis on digital transformation, especially around customer experience, operational efficiency and associated legacy transformation.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We won 4 large deals in the last quarter and 18 large deals in FY2022 from this segment.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Growth in Manufacturing segment increased to over 50% in constant currency.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: There were 6 large deal wins in this segment in the last quarter and 13 wins for the last year.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We are helping clients across engineering, IoT, supply chain, cloud ERP and digital transformation areas.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Hi-Tech growth accelerated further to 20.9% in constant currency.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We have seen an increase in deals based on edge computing, digital marketing and commerce.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Cybersecurity is another area of focus for clients due to increased threat perception.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Life Sciences vertical grew by 16.2% in constant currency.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Clients are driving digital transformation of clinical trials to reduce cycle times through direct data capture, digital patient engagement to accelerate drug discovery, and reducing costs.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: In the last quarter, we were rated as a leader in 11 ratings in the areas of cloud services, big data and analytics, IoT and engineering, modernization and artificial intelligence.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We announced the acquisition of oddity, a Germany-based digital marketing and experience and e-commerce agency.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Together with Wongdoody, this will further strengthen our creative branding and experience design capabilities.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: With respect to capital allocation, the Board has proposed a final dividend of Rs.16 per share, taking the total dividend for financial year 2022 to Rs.31 per share, an increase of 14.8% over the past year.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: I want to express Infosys' support for all the people impacted by the humanitarian crisis in Europe.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: The company advocates for peace between Russia and Ukraine.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: While Infosys does not have any active relationships with local Russian enterprises.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We have a small team of less than 100 employees based in Russia, which service a few of our global clients.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: In light of the prevailing situation, we made a decision to transition these services from Russia to our other global delivery centers.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: To support this humanitarian assistance initiatives in the region, Infosys has committed $1 million towards Ukrainian relief efforts and is launching a program to digitally reskill up to 25,000 individuals.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: With that, let me hand it over to Nilanjan for his update.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nilanjan Roy We navigated yet another year of a challenging environment with strong growth of 19.7% in constant currency, which is highest in a decade.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: The incremental revenue added this year was higher than the incremental revenue added in the previous 3 years together.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: This was backed by broad-based growth across segments and robust growth in our digital portfolio at 41.2% in constant currency.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Operating margin for the fiscal stood at 23.0%, which was at the midpoint of our guidance band of 22% to 24%.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: In the backdrop of various supply side pressures, we rolled out various measures to reduce attrition – higher compensation increases, higher promotions, skill-based interventions, etc.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: in addition to higher subcons.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Free cash flows for FY2022 crossed $3 bn.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: DSO reduced by 4 days to 67 days.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: Capex increased marginally to $290 million on the back of continued focus on optimizing the infra creation-related spend.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Consequently, FCF conversion as a percentage of net profit was 103% for FY2022.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: FY2022 EPS grew by 14.3% in dollar terms and 15.2% in INR terms.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Return on equity at 29.1% improved by 1.7% over the prior year.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Coming to Q4 performance - Revenues grew by 20.6% YoY in constant currency and 1.2% sequentially.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Growth was broad-based across verticals and geos and was in double digits.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Although volume growth remained healthy in Q4, revenue growth in Q4 was impacted by usual seasonality, COVID impact during the early part of the quarter and the client related contractual provision, which we expect to recover in the future.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: This also impacted Q4 margins.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: Mining of large clients was extremely strong in FY2022.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: $100 mn client count increased to 38 compared to 32 in FY2021.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We had 12 clients giving $200 mn annual revenues compared to 7 in FY2021.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: We have added ~22,000 net employees, including trainees during the quarter, the highest ever in the company's history, as we made headroom to capture the robust demand environment ahead.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Consequently, utilization in Q4 declined to 87.0% while on-site effort mix inched up to 24.0%.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: Voluntary LTM attrition increased to 27.7%.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: While LTM attrition continues to increase due to the tail effect, quarterly annualized attrition saw a decline of approximately 5% after flattening in the previous quarter.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: Q4 margins stood at 21.5%, a drop of 200 basis points versus previous quarter.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: The major components of the sequential margin movement were as follows: - 1.6% impact due to lower calendar working days, client contractual provision as explained above and other pricing puts and takes, - 0.6% impact due to lower utilization as we create capacity for the future, - 1% due to higher visa costs, third-party costs and other one-offs, which we benefited in Q3, and these were offset by - approximately 1.1% benefit due to salary-related benefits, including lower working days, leave costs and others.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: Q4 EPS grew by 9.2% in dollar terms and 13.4% in rupee terms on a YoY basis.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our balance sheet remained strong and debt-free.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Consolidated cash and equivalents increased further to $4.9 bn at the end of the quarter.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Free cash flow for the quarter was healthy at $761 million, and yield on cash balance remained stable at 5.29% in Q4.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: In line with our capital allocation policy, the Board has recommended a final dividend of Rs.16 per share, which will result in a total dividend of Rs.31 per share for FY2022 versus Rs.27 per share for FY2021, an increase of 14.8% per share for the year.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Including the final dividend and recently concluded buyback over the last 3 years, we have returned 73% of FCF to shareholders under our current capital allocation policy.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our accelerated investments in the last few years in strengthening our digital footprint, enhancing large deal capabilities, localization, talent building has enabled us to gain consistent market share.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: With the acceleration of digital disruptions across industries, we see further scope to engage more closely with clients and capitalize on the expanding market opportunities.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We have identified areas of investments, including doubling down our focus on digital portfolio, scaling our cloud offerings and further enhancing our capabilities in emerging technologies.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We also remain committed to offer a compelling value proposition to employees through reskilling, incentivization and a holistic career growth.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We plan to neutralize the impact of some of these through aggressive cost optimization and value-led pricing driven by service and brand differentiation.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: This, along with post-pandemic normalization of some expenses, like travel, facilities, etc, is reflected in the revised margin guidance for FY2023 of 21% to 23%.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: With the pandemic hopefully behind us, we hope to see many of you in person over the next few months.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: With that, we can open the call up for questions.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Ankur Rudra The first question is on the revenue guidance.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Last year at this time Salil, the revenue guidance was a bit low at the beginning of FY2022 and at that time I would say at least the order book was a lot stronger, you had a mega deal in the order book and perhaps a stronger exit rate.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: So curious to know, what gives the confidence of giving a slightly higher guidance at the beginning of this year, given, may be a more volatile macro situation.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Salil Parekh Hi Ankur thanks for your question.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: What we see today is the demand environment from our client base is strong.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We have for the year $9.5 bn in large deals, 40% net new, for the quarter $2.3 bn, 48% net new and a strong expansion in dimensions relating to new client work and relating to actual expansion across different strata.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Given all those factors, we came to view that we could see growth in the range of 13% to 15% for this financial year.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Ankur Rudra Understood this, does this bake in any kind of reversal that you alluded to from the client situation in fourth quarter?
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Salil Parekh The client situation of the fourth quarter will reverse over some period.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: We have not specified that.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: That reversal in any case is not such that will make a huge impact in the full year.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We see this coming really from the strong demand that we are seeing within the market from what we are seeing in the existing base of business that we have, the expansion within clients that we are seeing and some of the new client acquisitions that we are witnessing.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: So, putting all those factors we came to this view.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Ankur Rudra Thank you, appreciate this.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: The follow up question is on margin.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Maybe to start with could you elaborate the third-party cost which went up sharply this quarter and last quarter.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Is this the sticky new level given the nature of deals you are signing?
label: POSITIVE

sentence: And as a connected question could you elaborate the cost that has been baked into to the 2023 guidance on margins including the wage inflation levels, the extent of the pace of the reversal or normalization of the cost base.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nilanjan Roy I think many of the large deals which we get is through bundling our services with the software and the allied services and that gives us a multiplier effect in the client landscape.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: And that you have seen over the last few years, so that is one of the reason also you have seen the cost increase and has helped us in the quarter and the year going forward.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: On YoY perspective for FY2023 we do not call out the wage impact.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: As Salil said, it will be a competitive compensation hike.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We will differentiate hike in talent and in some places, it will be more broad-based and of course around that we have a lot of cost optimization which we usually do.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Some of them in the year past were tailwinds; for instance the onsite offshore mix.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: But subcon became a headwind for us last year and some of these in a way will start going the other way in the following year.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Of course, the wage hikes will hit us early on the year as well in quarter one itself, so that will be initial headwind, but we have seen the overall impact of our cost optimization.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: On pricing, we have started discussions as Salil mentioned earlier with our clients.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Of course, this is a much longer haul, it happens more on T&M, renewals etc.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: But for FP side of the business these are much more longer-term discussions.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: And these are also competitively bid but I think the discussions have started.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: All of our sales people are actively engaged in this and looking at the overall demand and the supply front on this and we have started making head way on this.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Ankur Rudra Thank you and best of luck.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Moshe Katri Thanks for taking my questions.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: It would be great if you can give us some more clarity and the client specific contractual position that you mentioned is getting lot of questions from the investors.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: How does that impact the revenue numbers for the quarter.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Is there a margin impact as well?
label: POSITIVE

sentence: I think any clarity is going to be really helpful.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: And this is a followup looking at the margin guidance for FY2023, I would see you have brought down by a 100 basis point.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: Are we assuming they picked up from the wage inflation here and then are we also assuming lower pricing power which is something that actually did help in terms of levers hardly for the past 6 to 12 months.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Thanks a lot.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nilanjan Roy Moshe we heard the first question on the client contractual provision.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Just to clarify this the numbers are very small.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: These are less than a percentage, so it is not a big impact overall as people are making it out.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So we just want to close that out.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: It is not a big impact but less than 1%.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: But since you are looking at revenue growth sequentially, I just wanted to call it out.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Moshe Katri The second question is to do with your margin guidance for FY23, does this actually factor an acceleration in wage inflation in FY2023 and maybe a lower pricing power also kind of not factored into those numbers?
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: Nilanjan Roy Okay Moshe , I could make out something you said about of wage inflation as well.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So yes, in Q1, we will do a compensation hike as well both offshore and onsite and like I said it will be competitive.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We will benchmark this, differentiate on talent side as well.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: And that is something we have seen over the last year has helped us, especially towards people with the higher skills set, so that is working for us.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: The overall margin guidance reflects a number of events.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We talked about some of the normalization of the pandemic benefits we have got on travel and facility, and some of that we are seeing is going to come back.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: And secondly, we are seeing some of the headwinds in terms of onsite-offshore which we think we have got a large benefit last year.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: So, we have to see how this opens up in the rest of the year.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: On the other hand, with our recruitment engine really kicking up now, we have seen subcon cost has actually plateaued during this quarter and we think for the rest of the year we should be able to pull back cost on subcon line.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Automation remains very core to us – cost optimization every year.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We are speaking of automating between 3000 to 4000 people and putting in BOTS and this I am talking about for the quarter, So, we have comprehensive plans and we have talked about pricing as well.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: 21% to 23% is a reasonable margin band we think we are comfortable to operate in for the next year.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: If you recall even pre pandemic in a way, we were in at 21% to 23% as we ended FY2020 which was the year before pandemic at 21.3% if I am not mistaken.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So, we are at 21% to 23% and it is a comfortable range we are happy to be in.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Nitin Padmanabhan Hi good evening just two questions from my side.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: The first one was on the guidance.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So, if I understand right, typically you have a high visibility for the next two quarters and if I look at the last year net new deal wins, it is actually lower than the prior year.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: So I was just wondering is the mix of much smaller deals which do not reflect within the overall large deal win number that you are talking about, is that a much higher number, is that we should think about it?
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Second is the pipeline of larger deals that could come through that is giving the confidence or is it the smaller deals?
label: POSITIVE

sentence: so that was the first question.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Salil Parekh Thanks for the question.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We are not specifying today the different types of deals within the mix.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Few points to give some color on it.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: First the pipeline that we see today is the largest pipeline we have in terms of large deals so that gives us a good confidence.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our net new for the year is strong.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We have good momentum exiting this financial year 2022, which gives us a good foundation for next year and we see continued traction within clients, as we are expanding as we are consolidating, as we are gaining market share, so that gives us added boost.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Hopefully that gives you a little bit of color on that.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nitin Padmanabhan Sure.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: The second question was in terms of how are you seeing onsite wage inflation broadly?
label: POSITIVE

sentence: When you compare the prior year, do you see that at a much higher level for the industry in the US, just wanted your thoughts on that.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: And finally, any specifics on the financial services space which is relatively softer and for life sciences where we actually saw a sharp drop for the quarter?
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: Salil Parekh On the wage inflation, outside India is definitely higher than what we were seeing last year and that will become a part of how we factor in our overall compensation increase.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Wage inflation numbers in most of the western geographies are higher today than they were 12 months ago.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: On financial services while in the quarter we saw the QoQ was lower, the overall demand environment remains very strong for us in this segment.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We see a good pipeline there.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: There were significant large deal wins for the year and in the quarter and we remain confident with the growth in financial services.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: In life sciences conversely, we had in the previous quarter several onetime large deals and that is what made the QoQ look softer.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: It is a smaller unit for us.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So, there is much more volatility in that, but the underlying demand in life sciences looks to be in good shape.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Keith Bachman I want to ask a question about what are your assumptions on attrition and utilization, how should we be thinking about those terms over FY2023 and specifically if you could correlate what is the impact in terms of your margin guidance that you provided here today of 21% to 23%?
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nilanjan Roy I think firstly on the utilization we are still at the higher end at 87%.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We want to bring this down.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Now having said that, a lot of this will happen through the influx of freshers.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So it is not a dollar for a dollar in that sense.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: The utilization will start impacting by putting in more freshers who are at a lower cost, but will still have a margin headwind.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: But if you looking for a math behind it there is no straight correlation because it is not one for one in that sense.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So that is first.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: On attrition, yes, we think that this should come down in the following year.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: The impact that we are seeing now – the impact of putting freshers in – not only by us, but by the entire industry because it was a rotational churn issue across the industry.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: As the industry puts in freshers, there is a new source of supply across the industry as well.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: And finally the intervention which we are doing now as well.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So, that is all factored into our 21% to 23%.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We are also looking at investments, like Salil said, around cloud, around digital capabilities; and therefore that is also baked into the next year’s guidance.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Keith Bachman Okay just to clarify and then I will see the floor, does the attrition come down for the industry or Infosys or both.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nilanjan Roy It will be both, I do not think we are in a silo on the ecosystem, we are all interconnected.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: My attrition is somebody else lateral and somebody else’s attrition is my lateral and therefore if the industry has to come out of this it is fundamentally through volume.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Volume has to be through fresher, there is no other source of volume.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Therefore, as we start pumping in more freshers send them for training put them into the bench and then get them into production.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: I think that cycle takes time, and you are already seeing the benefits of this – not only with us but also seeing that with the industry as well.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Sudheer Guntupalli Good evening gentlemen.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Thanks for giving me the opportunity.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Nilanjan as you made a comment that pre-pandemic we were at 21.3% margin and our current margin guidance band is also somewhere around that.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So should we read this margin downgrade as more of a structural reset in the company’s aspirational profitability going back to pre-COVID margin levels or should we see this more of a onetime downgrade for FY2023 led by transient supply side pressures.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: Nilanjan Roy Yes, so as you know, we only give the margin guidance for the year – 21% to 23% and FY2020 operating margin was 21.3%.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We will see where we end up, but the comfortable range for FY2023 is 21% to 23% - nothing more than that.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Just talking about the investments we are going to make- not only on talent.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: This is a robust demand environment and we do not want to lose highly skilled talents.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: So, we are rolling out interventions there.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We are rolling out intervention on the sales side, on the marketing side, on the digital, cloud.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So, we have multiple interventions and we have seen the success of that over the last 4 years and this is also in front of you.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: That is something which we have looked at and baked into the margin for next year.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Sudheer Guntupalli Sure Sir.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: An extension of this question, the current exit margin rate in March 2022 and margin downgrade for FY2023 it gives a bit of a deja vu feeling of the exit margin and guidance situation exactly 3 years ago in March 2019.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: In fact, we were not staring at so many margin headwinds like we are now barring a bit of an elevated attrition at that time.

sentence: So my question is, is it fair to assume that for the next four quarters margin trajectory will trace somewhat of a similar path like getting FY2020 where the current delta in growth will likely take care of the delta in margin headwinds or do you see any major divergences in terms of how the pattern will play out over the next four quarters.

sentence: Nilanjan Roy So, yes like I said on the margin side we know there is going to be a Q1 impact.

label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Looking forward I think this question has been attempted in different ways by some of the earlier questions that came through, but if you were to kind of think about your guidance on revenue for the full year and think about what are the puts and takes in terms of any delta that you might see on demand, how comfortable do you feel that you have a cushion?

sentence: Those are the things we built in, to build the guidance and that is the approach we take every year and in April as we look ahead and then as the year moves, as we get other information we try to then see how best to communicate what we are seeing in the demand environment.

sentence: It’s the same approach that we will follow.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So, it is difficult for example to say what does it mean there is a cushion and not cushion because at this stage what we see is what we are sharing which is 13% to 15% on the growth and in every quarter with the broad-based connection we have with clients and interactions across the industry we will continue to share what we see with respect to the demand environment.

sentence: Divya Nagarajan Got it and on the margin side I think you have spoken repeatedly about investments and the investments for future growth.

label: NEUTRAL

sentence: And then we have the cost optimization program which has been running quite well across all these years – automation, onsite-offshore, subcon – again which is also high, and then the investments which we are going to make.
